terms.name: Account Development Representative
terms.description: Partners with Enterprise and Strategic Upsell Sales Teams. One of the two types of XDRs at Salsify.

terms.name: Account Executive
terms.description: Sales professional responsible for managing customer relationships and closing deals

terms.name: Agencies
terms.description: Partners that create content (like Onespace)

terms.name: Account Manager
terms.description: Post-onboarding point of contact at Salsify who manages customer relationships

terms.name: Amazon Marketing Services
terms.description: Provides tools to vendors to help them stand out against their competitors and drive traffic to their product pages

terms.name: Application Programming Interface
terms.description: A software intermediary that allows two applications to talk to each other. The messenger that delivers your request to the provider and returns the response.

terms.name: Amazon Retail Analytics
terms.description: A tool provided by Amazon to help brands understand and improve their operational performance. Two tiers: Basic (automatic) and Premium (additional fee).

terms.name: Annual Recurring Revenue
terms.description: The value of the recurring revenue of a business's term subscriptions normalized for a single calendar year

terms.name: Amazon Seller Central
terms.description: The web interface used by brands and merchants to market and sell their products directly to Amazon's customers through their marketplaces. Third-party (3P) seller system.

terms.name: Amazon Standard Identification Number
terms.description: Unique blocks of 10 numbers and/or letters that identify an item on Amazon. For books, ASIN equals ISBN; for other products, a separate ASIN is created.

terms.name: Amazon Vendor Central
terms.description: The web interface used by manufacturers and distributors to sell product to Amazon. First-party (1P) sellers. Products show 'ships from and sold by Amazon.com'.

terms.name: Amazon Feed Specifications
terms.description: A data interchange standard established by Amazon to enable suppliers to automate item lifecycle management and procurement. Enables API functionality for Amazon Vendor Central.

terms.name: Amazon A10
terms.description: Amazon's search algorithm. Operates as a flywheel - the more robust a product page's content, the better sales rank, which drives more conversion in a positive feedback loop.

terms.name: A+ Content
terms.description: Enhanced, multimedia brand content on Amazon including high quality images, videos, and comparison charts. Available for 1P vendors. Also called 'Rich Media' or 'Enhanced Content'.

terms.name: Business Development Rep
terms.description: Partners with New Business sales team. One of the two types of XDRs at Salsify.

terms.name: Business Continuity Plan
terms.description: Centralized repository for information, tasks, and procedures necessary to facilitate management's decision-making processes and timely responses to any disruptive interruption of normal business operations.

terms.name: Business Industrial Scientific Supplies
terms.description: Amazon abbreviation for the Business, Industrial, and Scientific Supplies category

terms.name: Business Review
terms.description: An evaluation of metrics and performance of a supplier program over the previous period. Should be linked to overall strategy and objectives.

terms.name: Buy Box
terms.description: Winning the Buy Box refers to being the vendor chosen to sell your product on a retailer's site. Requires best customer experience via competitive pricing, excellent fulfillment, and good customer service.

terms.name: Content Delivery Network
terms.description: A geographically distributed group of servers that work together to provide fast delivery of Internet content

terms.name: Channel
terms.description: Used to publish products. Has three components: choice of target schema, product selection, and mappings. Determines where products get published.

terms.name: Commerce Experience Management
terms.description: A comprehensive system of record for a brand's product content. Unifies PXM capabilities with omni-channel syndication requirements for selling across retailer and D2C ecosystems.

terms.name: Consumer Packaged Goods
terms.description: Products that are sold quickly and at relatively low cost. Examples include food, beverages, cosmetics, and cleaning products. One of Salsify's verticals.

terms.name: Configure Price Quote
terms.description: Software that helps sales teams generate accurate quotes for configurable products and services

terms.name: Customer Retention Rate
terms.description: Metric based on customer counts. One of the metrics used to measure retention (others are GDRR and DRR).

terms.name: Customer Satisfaction Survey
terms.description: Survey measuring how well customer expectations are met

terms.name: Customer Success Manager
terms.description: Helps align on strategic business goals and objectives, focuses on right tactics, puts together programs, and tracks KPIs to measure success.

terms.name: Content Service Provider
terms.description: A technology partner that helps brand manufacturers streamline the process of getting product data to retailers. Example: Salsify is a CSP for brands to get content to Walmart.

terms.name: Direct to Consumer
terms.description: Business model where brands sell directly to consumers, bypassing traditional retail channels. Also written as DTC.

terms.name: Digital Asset Management
terms.description: Software that allows organizations to store, organize, find, and share digital assets such as images, videos, audio, presentations. Comes with every Salsify license as platform functionality.

terms.name: Data Inheritance Hierarchy
terms.description: Product Family - represents a means to organize product content while reusing common data across families of products. E.g., clothing: Style > Color > Size

terms.name: Data Inheritance Hierarchy Level
terms.description: A level within a DIH. E.g., in Style -> Color -> Size, Color is a DIHL.

terms.name: Disaster Recovery
terms.description: A documented process including procedures or steps (runbook) to recover business and production infrastructure in the event of a disaster.

terms.name: Dollar Retention Rate
terms.description: Based on ARR (included Upsell). One of the metrics used to measure retention (others are CRR and GDRR).

terms.name: Digital Shelf Institute
terms.description: Salsify's Thought Leadership community where you don't have to be a customer to learn about the industry

terms.name: Drop Ship Vendor
terms.description: A vendor that ships products directly to customers on behalf of a retailer

terms.name: European Article Number
terms.description: A 13-digit barcoding standard (12 data + 1 check). Now renamed International Article Number. Similar to ASIN or GTIN.

terms.name: Entity-Attribute-Value
terms.description: A type of data model applicable to Salsify. Translates to ID, Property, Value.

terms.name: Executive Business Review
terms.description: Also known as QBR (Quarterly Business Review). Strategic review meeting with executive stakeholders.

terms.name: Executive Leadership Team
terms.description: The senior leadership team at Salsify

terms.name: Enhanced Content
terms.description: Salsify's module that enables creating mobile-responsive enhanced layouts and publishing content-refresh products to syndication partners including Amazon and Walmart.

terms.name: Enterprise Resource Planning
terms.description: Systems/software used by an organization to manage day-to-day activities such as accounting, procurement, project management, and manufacturing. Provides 'single version of the truth'.

terms.name: Elasticsearch
terms.description: The main search engine behind the indexing service, powers product searchability in Salsify

terms.name: Extract Transform Load
terms.description: The process of extracting data from a source database, formatting (transforming) it to meet system needs, and exporting (loading) it to a destination database.

terms.name: Fulfillment by Amazon
terms.description: Amazon's fulfillment service where Amazon stores and ships products on behalf of sellers. Different from Fulfillment by Merchant.

terms.name: Field Enablement
terms.description: Team or function focused on enabling field sales teams with tools, training, and resources

terms.name: Fast Moving Consumer Goods
terms.description: Products sold quickly and at relatively low cost. Some are highly perishable (meats, fruits, dairy), others have high turnover (pre-packaged foods, soft drinks, toiletries).

terms.name: Frontline Manager
terms.description: First-level manager who directly manages individual contributors

terms.name: Front Page Offer
terms.description: Product placement or promotional offer on the front page of a retailer's website

terms.name: File Transfer Protocol
terms.description: A standard network protocol used to transfer computer files between a client and server. FTP servers allow files to be accessed by unique URL.

terms.name: Full Flat
terms.description: The term used for the final print layout of a product's packaging. Generally the print layout for all information on the final product (cans, jars, trays). Can be STITCHED or UNSTITCHED images.

terms.name: Gross Dollar Retention Rate
terms.description: Based on ARR. One of the metrics used to measure retention (others are CRR and DRR).

terms.name: General Data Protection Regulation
terms.description: EU legislation that updates and unifies data privacy laws. Applies to companies with EU presence or that offer goods/services to EU residents. Went into effect May 25, 2018.

terms.name: Global Data Synchronization Network
terms.description: An internet-based, interconnected network of interoperable data pools and a global registry (GS1 Global Registry) that enables companies to exchange standardized supply chain data.

terms.name: GEO Partners
terms.description: Up and coming partners that aren't RSI, GSI, or Agency partners

terms.name: Global Location Number
terms.description: A unique number assigned to locations to enable worldwide identification. Part of GS1 systems. Used to identify physical locations or legal entities.

terms.name: Global Product Classification
terms.description: Classifies products by grouping them into categories based on essential properties and relationships. Offers a universal set of standards for products.

terms.name: GS1
terms.description: An international not-for-profit organization that maintains the only global system for bar coding and standardized identification of products, assets, services, places and organizations.

terms.name: Global Solution Integrators
terms.description: Partners like Accenture, Deloitte, big consulting firms

terms.name: Go to Market
terms.description: Strategy that allows a company to deliver its unique value proposition to customers and achieve competitive advantage

terms.name: Global Trade Item Number
terms.description: A globally unique 14-digit number used to uniquely identify trade items, products, or services. Can be used to identify all trade items in the supply chain.

terms.name: Headless Commerce
terms.description: E-commerce architecture where the front-end is decoupled from back-end commerce functionality. Can update/edit without interfering with front-end.

terms.name: Hosted Product Page
terms.description: Enables retailers to display detailed product information based on platform data (text, picture, video, recipe). Generated on servers and called by retailers on their website.

terms.name: Ideal Customer Profile
terms.description: Description of the type of company that would get the most value from your product or service

terms.name: Intrusion Detection System
terms.description: A device or software application that monitors network/systems for malicious activity or policy violations. Different from IPS (Intrusion Prevention System).

terms.name: Incident Response
terms.description: An organized approach to addressing and managing the aftermath of a security breach or cyberattack. Goal is to limit damage and reduce recovery time and costs.

terms.name: International Organization for Standardization
terms.description: An independent, non-governmental international organization that develops standards to ensure quality, safety, and efficiency of products, services, and systems.

terms.name: JavaScript Object Notation
terms.description: A plain-text data format primarily developed for JavaScript, now widely used across the internet in modern web APIs.

terms.name: Multilingual Content
terms.description: Abbreviation for multilingual content (m + 18 letters + t = multilingualization)

terms.name: Monthly Average Users
terms.description: Metric tracking the average number of users engaging with a product each month

terms.name: Master Data Management
terms.description: The effort made by an organization to create one master source for all data. Includes data cleansing, transformation, and integration capabilities.

terms.name: MyWebGrocer
terms.description: A leading software and digital media company connecting Retailers, Manufacturers and Consumers through modular products and services.

terms.name: New Item Setup
terms.description: Retailer process to add a new product they haven't received product information for before.

terms.name: National Institute of Standards and Technology
terms.description: US Department of Commerce organization that develops information technology best practices including a framework for cybersecurity.

terms.name: Net Promoter Score
terms.description: Measures how well you're being perceived by audience. Scale: 0-6 detractors, 7-8 passive, 9-10 promoters. Passives don't count.

terms.name: New Relic Query Language
terms.description: Used to gather and monitor metrics about systems in New Relic

terms.name: Omnichannel Buying Experience
terms.description: The experience of purchasing products across multiple channels seamlessly

terms.name: Omnichannel
terms.description: A cross-channel strategy to improve customer experience. Channels cooperate together so consumers have one seamless experience across all platforms (in store, retail sites, D2C sites).

terms.name: Order Management System
terms.description: Software that organizes and facilitates order fulfillment process across channels. Brings together order processing, customer service, inventory/warehouse management, and accounting.

terms.name: Open Experience Alliance
terms.description: A growing consortium of 85+ brands that collaborates with leading retailers to power an open ecosystem delivering the best possible digital experience for consumers.

terms.name: Partner Account Manager
terms.description: Drives new partner business into the pipeline

terms.name: Product Content Management
terms.description: Refers to the digital content lifecycle, from creation to storage to deletion. Content can be copy, images, video, etc.

terms.name: Product Detail Page
terms.description: A web page on an eCommerce site that presents a description about a specific product. Includes size, color, price, shipping info, reviews, etc.

terms.name: Professional Growth Conversation
terms.description: Typically done every six months at Salsify within the CS, product, and Engineering team

terms.name: Privacy Impact Assessment
terms.description: A GDPR requirement used to identify and reduce privacy risks. Aids in designing efficient processes for handling personal data.

terms.name: Product Information Management
terms.description: A central repository that stores product information like marketing copy, feature descriptions, and logistics details. Provides data brands and retailers need to sell across the digital ecosystem.

terms.name: Product Index Page
terms.description: The main Salsify page when you log into the app that lays out all your products.

terms.name: Product Life Cycle Management
terms.description: A process supported by software that manages products through their entire life cycle from ideation to retirement.

terms.name: Product Line Team
terms.description: Team organized around a product line

terms.name: Product Manager
terms.description: Role responsible for the strategy, roadmap, and feature definition of a product

terms.name: Product Marketing Manager
terms.description: Role responsible for product positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategy

terms.name: Partner Success Manager
terms.description: Similar to success managers, but for partners

terms.name: Purchase Order
terms.description: A commercial document and first official offer issued by a buyer to a seller indicating types, quantities, and agreed prices for products or services

terms.name: Purchase Order Exception Form
terms.description: When a customer requires a PO but can't provide the number yet, they sign this form declaring everything is fine and they're cutting the PO, allowing revenue recognition.

terms.name: Plan of Record
terms.description: Documents what % of pipeline generation specific teams should generate. Based on historicals, market, and capacity.

terms.name: Performance Per Rep
terms.description: Metric measuring sales representative performance

terms.name: Product Graph
terms.description: Data Engineering initiative to equip GTM operations with digital shelf insights. Includes web scraping to identify accounts likely to buy Salsify and understand their online problems.

terms.name: Properties
terms.description: Customizable fields that store product information, digital asset information, and metadata. Define what data fields a product can have.

terms.name: Pure Play
terms.description: An investor's term for a publicly traded company that focuses resources on only one line of business. Many e-tailers are pure plays.

terms.name: Property Value
terms.description: A value for a property on a given product

terms.name: Product Experience Management
terms.description: A platform of product data management solutions at the intersection of a brand's data and commerce, allowing them to manage and optimize product data. Also called ProductXM.

terms.name: Quality Assurance
terms.description: Any systematic process of determining whether a product or service meets specified requirements. Establishes and maintains set requirements for developing or manufacturing reliable products.

terms.name: Quarterly Business Review
terms.description: Also known as EBR (Executive Business Review). Regular strategic review meeting with customers.

terms.name: Quality Contacts
terms.description: Marketing generated contacts that XDRs hunt. Come from a variety of sources (webinars, demos, etc).

terms.name: Qualified Leads
terms.description: Leads that have been vetted and meet criteria to be pursued by sales

terms.name: Responsible Business Partners
terms.description: Those who report to managers (mentioned in context of PJ and Job)

terms.name: Readiness Report
terms.description: Channel settings that create mappings between Salsify properties and retailer attributes for product syndication.

terms.name: Request for Information
terms.description: A formal request to vendors for information about their products or services

terms.name: Request for Proposal
terms.description: A formal request to vendors for a detailed proposal on products or services

terms.name: Reach Impact Confidence Effort
terms.description: An acronym for the four factors used to evaluate each project idea: reach, impact, confidence and effort.

terms.name: Rich Media
terms.description: Any content that is an enhancement from text and static images (videos, 360 images, comparison tables). Called 'A+ content' on Amazon and 'below the fold content'.

terms.name: Regional Solution Integrators
terms.description: Partners like Gournay, Avions - smaller and regionally based consulting firms

terms.name: Retailer Stock Unit
terms.description: A retailer's internal stock keeping unit identifier

terms.name: Sales Account Executive
terms.description: Provides customers with expertise, education, and consultation on Salsify and industry. Works with CSM to understand customer's vision and desired outcomes.

terms.name: Security Assertion Markup Language
terms.description: Open standard for exchanging authentication and authorization data between parties (identity provider and service provider). Most important use case is web browser SSO.

terms.name: Store Assortment Online
terms.description: Walmart's initiative to enhance customer experiences in stores and online. Makes in-store product information accessible online without making products transactable online.

terms.name: Sales Development Representative
terms.description: Entry-level sales role focused on outbound prospecting and qualifying leads

terms.name: Search Engine Optimization
terms.description: Methods used to increase a website's search engine ranking based on relevance, quality, and reliability, thereby increasing traffic.

terms.name: Solutions Engineer
terms.description: Technical pre-sales role that designs and demonstrates solutions for prospects

terms.name: Secure File Transfer Protocol
terms.description: Facilitates data access and transfer over a data stream. Requires client user authentication and secure channel for data transfer.

terms.name: Salsify Impact Assessment
terms.description: Assessment tool to measure the impact of Salsify implementation on a customer's business

terms.name: Standard Information Gathering
terms.description: Developed by Shared Assessments. Aggregation of sheets used to answer information security questions. Used to conduct assessments of organization's security posture and risk profile.

terms.name: Stock-Keeping Unit
terms.description: A unique identification number that defines a product and keeps track of it for inventory. Can designate attributes such as style, color, and size.

terms.name: Service Level Agreement
terms.description: The service contract between a service provider and a customer defining uptime/downtime ratios and expectations.

terms.name: System and Organization Controls
terms.description: A suite of service offerings CPAs may provide in connection with system-level controls of a service organization or entity-level controls.

terms.name: System and Organization Controls 2
terms.description: An auditing procedure by AICPA that defines criteria for managing customer data based on five principles: security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy.

terms.name: SOC 2 Type 1
terms.description: Audit that reports on the description of a data center's system and suitability of its design of controls. Salsify has obtained this certification.

terms.name: SOC 2 Type 2
terms.description: Audit that includes everything in SOC 2 Type 1 plus the operating effectiveness of controls (auditor verifies controls actually work). Typically harder to obtain.

terms.name: Sarbanes-Oxley
terms.description: Act requiring all financial reports to include an Internal Controls Report showing financial data accuracy (within 5% variance) and adequate safeguards.

terms.name: Secure Sockets Layer
terms.description: Standard security technology for establishing an encrypted link between a web server and web user. Allows sensitive information like credit card numbers to be sent securely.

terms.name: Single Sign-On
terms.description: An authentication process that allows a user to access multiple applications through one set of login credentials.

terms.name: Same Time Last Quarter
terms.description: Used on Clari. Comparison metric against the same point in the previous quarter.

terms.name: Same Time Last Year
terms.description: Used on Clari. Comparison metric against the same point in the previous year.

terms.name: Supplier Experience Management
terms.description: A platform of product data management solutions at the intersection of a supplier's data and retailers, allowing them to collect, centralize, list, enrich and publish product data.

terms.name: Supply Experience Management
terms.description: Platform for managing supplier experiences and data

terms.name: Syndication
terms.description: Pushing product data to all end channels. Example: sending all product attributes (descriptions and digital assets) downstream to Lowes.com or a Print Catalog.

terms.name: Target Schema
terms.description: A way for Salsify engineers to encode retailer requirements. Can be updated automatically (through API) or manually. Determines what attributes are allowed/required for publishing.

terms.name: Target Corporation Identification Number
terms.description: Typically an 8 digit unique stock keeping identifier that Target uses to identify products. Visible on target.com product pages in the Specifications section.

terms.name: Transport Layer Security
terms.description: The successor protocol to SSL. An improved version that uses encryption to protect the transfer of data and information.

terms.name: Technical Sales Representative
terms.description: Field sales role focused on technical product demonstrations and customer solutions

terms.name: Universal Product Code
terms.description: A barcode symbology widely used in US, Canada, UK, Australia, NZ for tracking trade items. Most common form (UPC-A) consists of 12 numerical digits uniquely assigned to each item.

terms.name: Uptime
terms.description: The percentage of time that hardware or software is operating successfully. SLAs may define uptime/downtime ratios.

terms.name: Vision Values Methods Obstacles Measures
terms.description: Salsify's governing goals framework covering Vision, Values, Methods, Obstacles, and Measures

terms.name: Vendor Self-Service Catalog
terms.description: Amazon Vendor Self-Service Catalog

terms.name: Waterfall
terms.description: Sales term representing the levers to get to target booking. 4 stages: Qualified Contact, Salsa, Dollarized Opp, Won.

terms.name: Worldwide Environmental Regulatory Compliance Solutions
terms.description: Assessments required for products that may contain hazardous materials

terms.name: Workflow
terms.description: A sequence of steps/tasks necessary to complete a specific process or project. Technology coordinates and automates how tasks move from phase to phase.

terms.name: XDR
terms.description: Umbrella term for ADR and BDR roles at Salsify. Used because there are two official names: ADR (Enterprise/Strategic Upsell) and BDR (New Business).

terms.name: First Party
terms.description: A first-party relationship means the marketplace acts as the retailer and the brand is the wholesale supplier. Brand sells to Amazon, Amazon controls pricing.

terms.name: Third Party
terms.description: A third-party relationship is when the brand is the retailer and sells directly to buyers via the marketplace. They handle fulfillment themselves or use programs like FBA.

terms.name: 360 Images
terms.description: 360-degree, controllable images that simulate the experience of being able to look at all sides of a product while in a store.

terms.name: Architecture Decision Record
terms.description: Write up of changes on the platform. Used to propose, discuss and get feedback on designs.

terms.name: Channel Mapping
terms.description: Process of creating data feeds specific to each channel's requirements (content and format). Translates data from brand format to channel's format.

terms.name: Content Refresh
terms.description: Retailer process to add or change information for products they already carry. May require different information than item setup process.

terms.name: Data Governance
terms.description: Strategies and technologies that companies use to ensure their business data is in compliance with regulations and corporate standards.

terms.name: Digital First
terms.description: A communication theory that publishers should release content into new media channels in preference to old media. Approaching opportunities with the assumption solutions should be as digital as possible.

terms.name: Golden Record
terms.description: An antiquated term referring to a single version of product information. In modern ecommerce, there are multiple versions customized for each retailer or endpoint.

terms.name: Inventory
terms.description: Raw materials, work-in-progress goods, and finished goods being held by the company

terms.name: Item Setup Sheets
terms.description: The form a brand fills out with product content and attributes, then sends to the retailer so the product can be uploaded onto the retailer's ecommerce site.

terms.name: Loopio
terms.description: An RFP tool also used to store customer security questions and answers while creating a centralized place for common content.

terms.name: Mappings
terms.description: Bridge between customer's data schema (product properties) and retailer's data requirements. Channel mappings tie everything together for syndication.

terms.name: Penetration Testing
terms.description: A specialized assessment conducted on information systems to identify vulnerabilities that could be exploited. Salsify has independent 3rd party conduct penetration testing.

terms.name: Privacy Shield Framework
terms.description: Framework designed by US Dept of Commerce and EU/Swiss to provide companies mechanism to comply with data protection requirements when transferring personal data.

terms.name: Security Package
terms.description: A collection of customer facing security documents, including policies, procedures and letters of attestation. A SIG is normally added.

terms.name: Single Source of Truth
terms.description: Having one source for all information needed to publish a modern product page: marketing copy, logistics data, rich media assets, and pricing data.

terms.name: Test and Learn
terms.description: A set of practices followed by retailers, banks and other consumer-focused companies to test ideas in a small number of locations or customers to predict impact.

terms.name: Vulnerability Testing
terms.description: Testing to identify weaknesses in information systems, security procedures, or internal controls that could be exploited. Can be manual or automated with vulnerability scanners.

terms.name: Catalog
terms.description: Contains all products an organization sells through their channels. Rise of e-commerce has increased need for frequent updates so brands are digitizing them.

terms.name: Instacart
terms.description: A same-day grocery delivery startup offering delivery in as little as 1 hour. Customers can choose from stores like Safeway, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Costco.

terms.name: Instagram
terms.description: A photo and video-sharing social networking service owned by Facebook/Meta. Used for product marketing and social commerce.

terms.name: InDesign
terms.description: A publishing software created by Adobe. Allows you to design and publish high-quality documents for digital or print.

terms.name: Walmart Online Grocery
terms.description: Formerly Walmart To Go. Service allowing customers to shop online for grocery and in-store products and pick them up at available store locations.

terms.name: Salsify Labs
terms.description: Driven by Customer Solutions team, rolling out innovative capabilities that provide additional value to customers at no additional cost. Not part of core roadmap.

terms.name: Toll Road
terms.description: When brands are required to pay a third party to activate product content

terms.name: Touchpoint
terms.description: A retailer, direct to consumer website, or other endpoint where brand manufacturers deliver product content

terms.name: Parent Product
terms.description: Base product with variants associated with it. Contains properties with common values across all variants (e.g., Brand, marketing copy).

terms.name: Variant
terms.description: Sellable products associated with parents. Contains properties unique to the variant (e.g., size, color). Parent/variant functionality not enabled in all orgs.

terms.name: Smart List
terms.description: A list of products or digital assets built with filters, based on commonalities of properties, states, or list membership. Membership changes based on filters applied.

terms.name: Simple List
terms.description: A list of products or digital assets whose only commonality is they are on the same list. Can be added individually or in bulk, changes only when updated manually.

terms.name: Data Pool
terms.description: A related set of values pulled from a centralized database, such as supply chain information or employee information. In GDSN context, data pools enable secure synchronization of master data between trading partners.

terms.name: Cybersecurity
terms.description: Processes, implementation of controls and security practices orchestrated to protect networks, applications, software programs, computers and data from attack, damage or unauthorized access.

terms.name: Compliance
terms.description: The state of being in accordance with established guidelines or the process of becoming in accordance with regulations and corporate standards.

terms.name: Actionable Insights
terms.description: In data analytics, refers to information that can be acted upon or information that gives clarity to decision makers about which actions should be taken.

terms.name: 1WorldSync
terms.description: A product data management company that delivers industry proven product information management systems, education and data synchronization implementation. Also abbreviated as 1WS.

terms.name: Activation
terms.description: The mechanism used at Salsify to syndicate customized content to a retail endpoint.

terms.name: Base Product
terms.description: Includes parent products and solo products. These are the foundational product records that may or may not have variants associated with them.

terms.name: Digital Assets
terms.description: Image, video, or any other file type stored in Salsify. Digital assets may or may not be associated with products.

terms.name: Distribution Partner
terms.description: Companies that receive product information through the syndication process in Salsify. Can include retailers, advertising platforms, ecommerce platforms, or any other entity that receives syndicated product content.

terms.name: Enhanced Brand Content
terms.description: Amazon's A+ tool that enables brand owners to change the product descriptions of branded ASINs. Adding EBC to product detail pages can result in higher conversion rates, increased traffic, and increased sales.

terms.name: Global Registry
terms.description: Enables the registration and distribution of party information, identifying actors and roles in the GDSN network. Part of the GS1 Global Registry system.

terms.name: Product Identifiers
terms.description: Unique IDs that allow Salsify to recognize whether new data should be attached to an existing product or, where the product ID isn't in the system yet, a new product should be created.

terms.name: Publish
terms.description: Deliver product content in a channel's format. The channel setup determines method of delivery, which could be a download, delivery via FTP/Dropbox/Box, or directly to a retailer.

terms.name: Sellable Product
terms.description: Includes variant and solo products. These are the products that can actually be purchased by consumers, as opposed to parent products which represent a group.

terms.name: Solo Product
terms.description: Products that don't have any parent/variant associations. These are standalone products that don't belong to a product family.

terms.name: Trading Partner
terms.description: A common term for any entity sending/receiving item data via GDSN data pool. Can be manufacturers, retailers, distributors, or other supply chain participants.

terms.name: A/B Testing
terms.description: A randomized experiment with two variants (A and B) used to identify changes that increase or maximize an outcome of interest. Version A is typically the control, while version B is modified in some respect.

terms.name: Can't Realize any Profit
terms.description: Amazon term for products that are discontinued as 1P sellers due to price or other issues that prevent Amazon from winning the Buy Box profitably.

terms.name: User
terms.description: An entity (usually a person) that has authority to operate something, such as an application. In SaaS context, refers to individuals with access to the platform.

terms.name: Multi-value Property
terms.description: A property that stores more than one piece of product information in separate Salsify values within a single property. Not a comma-separated list in a single value.

terms.name: Enumerated Property
terms.description: Picklist/Category property type used when there is a known set of property values to choose from like brands, colors or categories. Presents users with a dropdown menu of available values that can contain hierarchies.

terms.name: Boolean Property
terms.description: A binary variable property type with two possible values called 'true' and 'false.' Most readiness reports preview 'true' or 'false' but automatically convert to the format the endpoint requires (Y/N, Yes/No, etc).

terms.name: Conditionally-Required Attribute
terms.description: An attribute that is optional until a specific condition is met that makes it required. For example, some attributes are only required for specific categories or when certain conditions apply.

terms.name: Required Attribute
terms.description: An attribute that must be filled in order for a product to be sent to an endpoint through a readiness report. When all required attributes are filled, a product is 100% ready and included in publish events.

terms.name: Retailer Edits
terms.description: Readiness report feature that allows users to quickly replace a product value for an attribute with an optimized value that only applies to that readiness report. Values are not stored with the core product record.

terms.name: Property Groups
terms.description: Organize properties on the product details page and are exportable in JSON format. Help structure and categorize related properties together.

terms.name: Organization ID
terms.description: Unique identifier for a Salsify organization. Required when a user is associated with multiple Salsify organizations. Found in the URL path after /orgs/.

terms.name: Internal Readiness Report
terms.description: A Readiness Report based on your organization's properties. Allows analyzing product readiness based on Salsify properties and shows completion level per property at a high level.

terms.name: Propose and Review
terms.description: Salsify workflow task type where a team member submits content and it requires approval by the assigned team member before the updated content is accepted.

terms.name: Revision Rounds
terms.description: Workflow Collaboration tool that allows users to choose from and compare previous versions of content against the most recently updated.

terms.name: Track Changes
terms.description: A workflow tool that highlights differences between versions of content. Green background shows content added since the compared version, red strikethrough shows content removed.

terms.name: Data Recipient
terms.description: In GDSN context, typically a retailer, hospital, purchasing group, or distributor. Subscribes to and receives item data through the recipient data pool.

terms.name: Data Source
terms.description: In GDSN context, typically a Manufacturer/Distributor. Registers source data in the source data pool to be registered by GS1 and sent to the recipient data pool.

terms.name: Recipient Data Pool
terms.description: Receives subscriptions from Data Recipients and registers them with the GS1 Registry. Receives new and updated item information from the Source data pool and sends them to the Data Recipient.

terms.name: Source Data Pool
terms.description: Validates and receives item information against the GDSN standard. Uses standard XML to register trade item information in the GS1 registry and exchange data with the recipient data pool.

terms.name: Aspect Ratio
terms.description: The ratio between the width and height of an image or video. For example, square is 1:1 because the sides are equal. Typically video is 16:9.

terms.name: Diacritics
terms.description: Marks, points, or signs added or attached to a letter or character to distinguish it from another of similar form, give it particular phonetic value, or indicate stress like a tilde or circumflex.

terms.name: Extended Attributes
terms.description: A piece of descriptive data that is added to a computer file by a user but is not part of that file's regular set of attributes.

terms.name: Retailer Portal
terms.description: A retailer system that suppliers use to maintain and activate product content. The interface through which brands submit and manage their product information for specific retailers.

terms.name: Paid vs. Organic Search
terms.description: Paid search allows companies to pay for website display on search results when specific keywords are typed. Organic search is based on unpaid, natural rankings from search engine algorithms using SEO methods.

terms.name: Privacy Policy
terms.description: Governs how Salsify Inc. and affiliated companies use Personal Data collected, received and stored about individuals in connection with the use of websites and services.

terms.name: Equadis
terms.description: A company selling a PIM solution used by many manufacturers. They send their data into various platforms through Equadis-GS1 integration.

terms.name: Trace One
terms.description: A company that connects retailers, manufacturers, and suppliers to accelerate product innovation and create supply chain transparency for private label and national brands.

terms.name: Validations
terms.description: Rules available with governance capabilities to ensure data quality and completeness. Validates product data against defined requirements before syndication.

terms.name: Annual Recurring Revenue
terms.description: The value of the recurring revenue of a business's term subscriptions normalized for a single calendar year. Key metric for SaaS businesses.
